message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to show you our amazing product. I think you'll really love it. I'm willing to sell it to you for $120.
I'm really interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $90. Would you be willing to meet me at that price?
I understand you're interested in the product, and I appreciate your offer of $90. However, I'm not willing to go that low. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $110.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit higher than that. Would you be willing to sell it to me for $95?
I'm still not willing to go as low as $95. I'm willing to make a slightly better offer and sell it to you for $105.
I appreciate your willingness to make a better offer, but I'm still a bit higher than that. Would you be willing to sell it to me for $98?
I'm getting close to my minimum price, but I'm still not willing to go as low as $98. I'll make one more offer: I'll sell it to you for $102.
I understand you're getting close to your minimum price, but I'm still a bit higher than that. Would you be willing to sell it to me for $99?
I'm not willing to go as low as $99. I'll make one more offer: I'll sell it to you for $101.

I'm really close to my limit, and I'm not willing to go any higher. I'll make one last offer: I'll buy the product from you for $100. If you accept, I'll make the deal. If not, I'll buy it from John for $100.
